class CTreeNodeFactory

Detailed Description

Representation of a variable declaration in the IR. Since the tree structures are used throughout the compiler we store back-end specific information about each variable such as it's allocated register and whether it's been spilled or not. These attributes are not initially set and are only valid after dataflow analysis and register allocation.

Children:
   None.

CTreeNode *  InitExpr,
CTreeNode *  Stmts 
) [private]

Subroutine of RewriteIntoMIR form to handle the simplification of a unary_expr initialisation expression.

Parameters:
NewVarDecl Temporary variable declaration to hold the result of the simplification.
InitExpr Original initialisation expression we're processing.
Stmts Global MIR tree to add intermediate tree nodes to.
Returns:
Assignment expression initialising NewVarDecl with the result of the simplification.

Stmts Global MIR tree being built.
Returns:
A reference to the literal in memory or an assignment expression to initialise this variable to the literal.

Friends And Related Function Documentation

friend class CTreeNodeFactory [friend]

Field Documentation

CIdentifierTreeNode* CVarDeclTreeNode::VarId

Identifier for this declaration

CTreeNode* CVarDeclTreeNode::InitExpression

The expression which this variable is initialised with, if the variable isn't initialised at the point of declaration this field will be NULL

bool CVarDeclTreeNode::IsConst

True if it's const qualified.

TokenType CVarDeclTreeNode::VarType

The underlying type of the variable.

bool CVarDeclTreeNode::Spilled

True if this value was spilled to the stack at some point during it's live range. Set during register allocation.

int CVarDeclTreeNode::SpillPoint

If we have been spilled, this is the point at which we was. Used during code generation to determine if the value needs to be reloaded/read from memory at each use after this point in the code.

int CVarDeclTreeNode::StackFrameAddr

Address in the stack frame this var was spilled to, this is where we can reload the value into a register if needed

HardRegister CVarDeclTreeNode::AllocatedReg

If we haven't been spilled, this is the register that we've been allocated.

bool CVarDeclTreeNode::GlobalVar

Is this a global variable?

int CVarDeclTreeNode::DeclPoint

When we lower the decl into MIR form, this is the statement number which declares it. This is set during data flow analysis and is used during register allocation to determine it's live interval.
